name: TheAtlantic
text: The positive First Amendment "lies at the foundation of many of today’s arguments for greater government involvement in the media marketplace," @batesunlv writes: https://t.co/sA3FtxS6KF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Republican judges are serious about using their power to obstruct Democrats in office, even when doing so is legally indefensible and blatantly undemocratic—indeed, even when it jeopardizes human life," @nicholas_bagley writes: https://t.co/R7qSQIKoPl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This recession and recovery have proved particularly skewed: Normalcy for some, apocalypse for others," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/NU4iqIWzKe

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: This is a great @edyong209 article about the Trump Administration's response to the pandemic and Mike Pence should read it: 
https://t.co/oqzVvOs6TX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
“Even as Kamala Harris sought a job that has been defined by its lack of power,” @megangarber writes, “people found ways to complain that she was seeking too much power.”

https://t.co/PvO9HytDNb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Confrontations between unorganized, self-appointed poll watchers and individual voters are a recipe for trouble—and a threat to a fair election," @wiczipedia writes: https://t.co/ebdf2jpomq

name: TheAtlantic
text: Since the president tweeted that he has COVID-19, his replies have been full of strange hexes. This bizarre display is just another example of how the whole internet has been taken over by pop-music stans, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/3vamc2PcBa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Long before Kamala Harris became a national figure, India played a role in American politics, @DinyarPatel writes: https://t.co/qVjUWfHyTv

name: TheAtlantic
text: For some White House aides, satisfying Trump's need for validation is a part of the job, @PeterAtlantic reports. https://t.co/G8BaRar4sm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris offered America a window into a world where Donald Trump isn’t president, @russellberman wrote of last night's debate. https://t.co/gbZaN5T8Fk

name: TheAtlantic
text: As the Buddha reportedly said, “Those attached to perception and views roam the world offending people.” Nowadays, people's obsession with their political views is hurting their well-being and relationships, @arthurbrooks argues in 'How to Build a Life': https://t.co/ZVmHqoOkmv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the court of the mad king, a positive test, and a presumed recovery, is perhaps essential for every courtesan who wants to be in the inner circle," @CaitlinPacific writes: https://t.co/mKDde3zFQj

name: TheAtlantic
text: If the U.S. withdraws from the World Health Organization, @anneapplebaum writes, it “will lose yet another battle in an ideological war that most of us don’t even know we are fighting.” https://t.co/tC3HsYnXor

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: A frightening and seismically important new piece from @anneapplebaum:
https://t.co/opT02qGhJB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: Donald Trump has been wantonly abandoning international institutions. China is quietly stepping into the vacuum. https://t.co/1t2Sn9VUfD

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: .@CaitlinPacific on Chris Christie: "Will the man ever learn? When has his relationship with Trump ever brought him anything but misery? Some people are drawn to bullies...."
https://t.co/0Qcek4fy1F

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @GrahamDavidA: "Have you seen the video of President Donald Trump’s triumphant trip back from Walter Reed? You would think the man was returning from liberating Europe, not getting a steroid shot in Bethesda." https://t.co/TjZkTN3LdB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: "If Democrats win big in November, court packing will be an urgent and live question that Biden and Harris will have to take on within their coalition. Evasion isn’t a good enough answer," @emmaogreen writes: https://t.co/3MXUk3ihQ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Harris’s success will help a lot of Black girls and women feel seen. She has a long history of breaking barriers—as the first Black woman elected as a district attorney, and then later attorney general, in California," @JemeleHill writes: https://t.co/f5n8nEz6PM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"We look at the world once in childhood. The rest is memory."

Elizabeth Strout discusses “Nostos,” a poem by Louise Glück—who just won a Nobel Prize—and the powerful way literature can harbor recollection: https://t.co/q6ElwjfGdG

name: TheAtlantic
text: The documentary "Siempre, Luis" explores the life of Luis Miranda, Lin-Manuel's dad. @pollackpelzner talked to Luis about the Puerto Rican–diaspora, the protests that challenged "Hamilton," and what it will take for Democrats to win in November: https://t.co/DOMc3jPyGL

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Every year, 1/3 of the world's food is lost or wasted. Yet, in 2019, about 2 billion people didn’t have regular access to safe, sufficient food. Find out how a community app is helping reduce waste and get food to neighbors in need @Barclays https://t.co/wnUv5QaWzX https://t.co/U6Sfq4CUFh
